text: people sat down with us and actually
laughed at some of the things that we
wanted to do and wanted to achieve and
to be honest rightly so you know I had
turn around in the meet and I said you
know I I want to play football in the
Antarctic and literally everyone laughed
at the table and it was like no I'm sick
I'm totally serious you know we want to
do this Michael Palin said that you're a
good observer in your documentary that's
got one the better compliments yeah I
mean coming from obviously a man like
Michael that's that's a huge compliment
but I do you know I'd love to kind of
dive into different cultures and see
different things and go to different
places that I've never been to before
and obviously on this trip the only
place I had spent a lot of time was
Miami
and obviously Manchester but the rest of
the places I've never been to before so
it was exciting on that side of the
defense as well because the idea is
seven games in seven continents in ten
days the first free places are our
UNICEF centers that we help support and
fund and and that was personally
important to me but the the other places
it was also about showcasing how the
power of the game affects you know
people families in life and and through
devastation and I kind of kind of wanted
to showcase that in the best possible
way and the climax was at Old Trafford
in Manchester the day after the Paris
attacks which of course involved
football the France Germany game so how
did that impact on your event the fact
that the game went ahead the fact that
the fans turned up 75,000 people turned
up showed a real unity I felt we wanted
to make sure the game went on because it
was sign of how powerful this game you
know and and is and how it can bring
people together this is all about than
the title says it for the love of the
game showing the positive signs that
football can give around the world it
has not been a good year for football
around the world what have you made of
what's going on at FIFA
I think it's not been a good time this
year and
a little bit of last year on the
governing body side the game is always
positive because it's the biggest and
strongest game of sport in the world so
that's not changed but obviously what's
gone on in FIFA the talks of corruption
that has been a negative the game will
continue to go on and will continue to
be as popular as ever
without certain individuals you were so
involved in the 2018 bid did you have
any inkling of what was going on no not
at all Russia I'm sure they will host a

those decisions should stay exactly how
they are you know those decisions were
made the World Cup has always been about
having it in countries that have never
had it before Russia's never had it
before it's gonna change that country
it's going to change people's lives with
you know jobs coming up and with with
the help of you know the sport so you
know that should that should stay
what's it Beckham Christmas like I think
like every other persons Christmas you

you know when we enjoy ourselves we have
a traditional Christmas dinner
so we're exactly the same we always
spend Christmas in London because it's
home and all obviously all of our family
are here so you know we're very
traditional I imagine Victoria is pretty
